summary: This is an email chain from December 2007 discussing the preparation of a factual basis document for a plea conference in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The correspondence is between Assistant U.S. Attorneys, with one expressing frustration about the process and confirming that only their office and the FBI are sources of information.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the main email, expressing that the situation is 'very demoralizing' and confirming that only their office and the FBI are sources of information for the plea conference document.

events.title: Plea Conference Date Set
events.description: A date of December 21, 2007, is mentioned as being set for a plea conference in the Jeffrey Epstein case.

locations.context: Office address of an Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the Epstein case correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from December 2007 regarding the preparation of a factual basis for a plea conference in the Epstein case.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney states the only sources of information for the plea document are 'our Office and the FBI'.
The same prosecutor expresses that they find the situation 'very demoralizing'.
A plea conference date of December 21, 2007, is referenced.
The correspondence indicates coordination between prosecutors to prepare 'something short and sweet with no names' for the plea conference.
